Package com.linecorp.armeria.common.logging

Interface RequestLog

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultRequestLog
    public interface RequestLog
    A set of informational properties collected while processing a Request and its Response. The properties provided by this class are not always fully available. Check the availability of each property using isAvailable(RequestLogAvailability) or availabilities(). Attempting to access the properties that are not available yet will cause a RequestLogAvailabilityException. Use addListener(RequestLogListener, RequestLogAvailability) to get notified when the interested properties are available.
    See Also:
    RequestContext.log(), RequestLogAvailability, RequestLogListener

      Adds the specified RequestLogListener so that it's notified when all of the specified RequestLogAvailabilitys are satisfied.

        Adds the specified RequestLogListener so that it's notified when all of the specified RequestLogAvailabilitys are satisfied.

      • context

        RequestContext context()
        Returns the RequestContext associated with the Request being handled. This method returns non-null regardless the current RequestLogAvailability.

      • method

        default HttpMethod method()
        Returns the method of the Request. This method is a shortcut to context().method(). This method returns non-null regardless the current RequestLogAvailability.

      • path

        default String path()
        Returns the absolute path part of the Request URI, excluding the query part, as defined in RFC3986. This method is a shortcut to context().path(). This method returns non-null regardless the current RequestLogAvailability.

      • query

        @Nullable
default String query()
        Returns the query part of the Request URI, without the leading '?', as defined in RFC3986. This method is a shortcut to context().query(). This property is available regardless the current RequestLogAvailability.

      • requestStartTimeMillis

        long requestStartTimeMillis()
        Returns the time when the processing of the request started, in millis since the epoch.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestStartTimeNanos

        long requestStartTimeNanos()
        Returns the time when the processing of the request started, in nanoseconds. This value can only be used to measure elapsed time and is not related to any other notion of system or wall-clock time.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestEndTimeNanos

        long requestEndTimeNanos()
        Returns the time when the processing of the request finished, in nanoseconds. This value can only be used to measure elapsed time and is not related to any other notion of system or wall-clock time.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestDurationNanos

        long requestDurationNanos()
        Returns the duration that was taken to consume or produce the request completely, in nanoseconds.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestLength

        long requestLength()
        Returns the length of the request content.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestCause

        @Nullable
Throwable requestCause()
        Returns the cause of request processing failure.
        Returns:
        the cause. null if the request was processed completely.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • responseStartTimeMillis

        Throws:

        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

        long responseEndTimeNanos()

        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

        Throws:

        Throws:

        @Nullable
Throwable responseCause()
        Returns the cause of response processing failure.
        Returns:
        the cause. null if the response was processed completely.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • totalDurationNanos

        long totalDurationNanos()
        Returns the amount of time taken since the Request processing started and until the Response processing ended. This property is available only when both RequestLogAvailability.REQUEST_START and RequestLogAvailability.RESPONSE_END are available.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • channel

        @Nullable
Channel channel()
        Returns the Netty Channel which handled the Request.
        Returns:
        the Netty Channel. null if the Request has failed even before a connection is established.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

        Returns the SessionProtocol of the Request.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

        Returns the SerializationFormat of the Request.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

        Scheme scheme()
        Returns the Scheme of the Request.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • host

        @Nullable
@Deprecated
default String host()
        Deprecated.
        Do not use this method. Get the remote or local address from context() or get the authority from authority().
        Returns the host name of the Request.
        Returns:
        the host name. null if the Request has failed even before a connection is established.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • authority

        default String authority()
        Returns the authority of the Request.
        Returns:
        the authority. "?" if the Request has failed even before its headers are properly constructed.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • status

        default HttpStatus status()
        Returns the status of the Response.
        Returns:
        the HttpStatus. HttpStatus.UNKNOWN if the Response has failed even before receiving its first non-informational headers.
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • statusCode

        default int statusCode()
        Returns the status code of the Response.
        Returns:
        the integer value of the status(). 0 if the Response has failed even before receiving its first non-informational headers.

      • requestHeaders

        HttpHeaders requestHeaders()
        Returns the HttpHeaders of the Request. If the Request was not received or sent at all, it will return a dummy HttpHeaders whose :authority and :path are set to "?", :scheme is set to "http" or "https", and :method is set to "UNKNOWN".
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • requestContent

        @Nullable
Object requestContent()
        Returns the high-level content object of the Request, which is specific to the SerializationFormat.
        Returns:
        RpcRequest for RPC, or null for others
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • rawRequestContent

        @Nullable
Object rawRequestContent()
        Returns the low-level content object of the Request, which is specific to the SerializationFormat.
        Returns:
        ThriftCall for Thrift, or null for others
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • responseHeaders

        HttpHeaders responseHeaders()
        Returns the non-informational status HttpHeaders of the Response. If the Response was not received or sent at all, it will return a dummy HttpHeaders whose :status is "0".
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • responseContent

        @Nullable
Object responseContent()
        Returns the high-level content object of the Response, which is specific to the SerializationFormat.
        Returns:
        RpcResponse for RPC, or null for others
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • rawResponseContent

        @Nullable
Object rawResponseContent()
        Returns the low-level content object of the Response, which is specific to the SerializationFormat.
        Returns:
        ThriftReply for Thrift, or null for others
        Throws:
        RequestLogAvailabilityException - if this property is not available yet

      • toStringRequestOnly

        String toStringRequestOnly()
        Returns the string representation of the Request, with no sanitization of headers or content.

      • toStringRequestOnly

        String toStringRequestOnly​(Function<HttpHeaders,HttpHeaders> headersSanitizer,
                           Function<Object,Object> contentSanitizer)
        Returns the string representation of the Request.
        Parameters:
        headersSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing HTTP headers for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as headers.
        contentSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing request content for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as content.

      • toStringResponseOnly

        String toStringResponseOnly()
        Returns the string representation of the Response, with no sanitization of headers or content.

      • toStringResponseOnly

        String toStringResponseOnly​(Function<HttpHeaders,HttpHeaders> headersSanitizer,
                            Function<Object,Object> contentSanitizer)
        Returns the string representation of the Response.
        Parameters:
        headersSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing HTTP headers for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as headers.
        contentSanitizer - a Function for sanitizing response content for logging. The result of the Function is what is actually logged as content.
